ichor.core.useful_functions.dl_poly namespace

Submodules

ichor.core.useful_functions.dl_poly.dl_poly_write_optimization_files module

write_config(atoms: Atoms, system_name: str, cell_size: float = 50.0, file_name: str = 'CONFIG')

Writes CONFIG file that DL_FFLUX needs to run.

Parameters:

  • atoms – An Atoms instance that is the starting geometry of the DL_FFLUX MD simulation

  • cell_size – The box size. Default is 50x50x50 Angstroms. Can be a cube only.

  • system_name – The system name

Parm file_name:

The name of the config file. It has to be CONFIG to be read in correctly by DL_FFLUX.

write_control(system_name: str, ensemble: str = 'nvt', thermostat: str = 'hoover', hoover_number: float = 0.04, temperature: int = 1, timestep: float = 0.001, n_steps: int = 500, file_name: str = 'CONTROL')

Writes CONTROL file that DL_FFLUX needs to function. It is a modified version of the DL_POLY CONTROL file. The defaults of the function are used to perform a geometry optimization, so the settings are different that the default settings.

Parameters:

  • system_name – The name of the system

  • thermostat – The thermostat to use for the simulation, defaults to hoover (Nose-Hoover thermostat)

  • hoover_number – The relaxation constant of Nose-Hoover thermostat in ps, defaults to 0.04

  • temperature – The temperature to run the simulation at, defaults to 0.0 (note that simulation is actually ran at 10K) because zero keyword is also added.

  • timestep – The timestep time, defaults to 0.001 ps

  • n_steps – The number of timesteps for the simulation, defaults to 500

Parm ensemble:

The ensemble to use for the simulation, defaults to nvt

write_field(atoms: Atoms, system_name: str, file_name='FIELD')

Writes out DL FFLUX FIELD file.

Parameters:

  • atoms – An Atoms instance which contains a geometry of the chemical system of interest.

  • system_name – The name of the system

  • file_name – The FIELD file name, defaults to “FIELD”
